SubIndicatorTextImage.heading: What does it mean to have self-determination?
SubIndicatorTextImage.subhead: Being self-determined means that you are able to speak up for yourself, make decisions and communicate them to others in the classroom, community, and at work. Self-determination also means that you can make a plan to get yourself from where you are right now to who you want to be in the future. In order to be self-determined, you’ll need to know more about yourself (self awareness) and be able to identify goals that reflect what you want and what interests you.
SubIndicatorTextImage.bullets:
• What are some things in your life that you make your own decisions on?
  • What are some activities or areas in your life that you’d like to have more choice in what/how you do something?
  • Do you feel confident in speaking up for yourself in school or in IEP meetings?

SubIndicatorTextImage.heading: What does self-determination skills development include?
SubIndicatorTextImage.subhead: Your transition team can help you explore what self-determination skills development can look like for you, by making sure that you...
SubIndicatorTextImage.bullets:
• Have confidence in speaking up for your needs in all areas of life
  • Recognize your interests and goals for the future
  • Know how to look at different situations, break down the steps and figure out what work needs to be done to reach your goals
  • Know how to look at all your options and make choices for yourself now and for your future

SubIndicatorVideoImage.heading: What’s self-determination all about? Let’s unpack it together!

IconTile2Heading.heading: What can self-determination do for you?
IconTile2Heading.subheading: When your transition team supports you with being a decision maker, you’ll have

IconTile2.heading: Problem-Solving Skills
IconTile2.content: Ability to find different solutions to problems and pick the one that helps you reach your goal with the least amount of challenges

IconTile2.heading: Self-Advocacy Skills
IconTile2.content: Speaking up for yourself and what supports you need

IconTile2.heading: Choice-making skills
IconTile2.content: Knowing how to get all the info that you need to compare the benefits and impacts of all your options when trying to reach a goal

IconTile2.heading: Goal Setting
IconTile2.content: Understanding what you want to learn more about, achieve, and do now and in the future

testimonialList.title: Family of transition-age youth
testimonialList.description: In Harrisburg I testified in front of legislators to advocate for myself and others around me.” Transition-age youth “He came to the realization that, ‘Okay, I’m an adult now. I have the ability to make those choices for myself.’ So he’s realizing as he goes along that he has a voice and his voice is being heard.
